name: San Diego Marriott Marquis & Marina

reviews.text: I normally stay in the gas lamp district when i'm in town to enjoy the nightlife, but took the lazy option since I was attending a conference next door. Definitely glad I made this choice as it was an excellent room with a superb view and much quieter than the previous hotels i've stayed in. Staff were very helpful, the room was comfortable and housekeeping kept it spotless.
reviews.title: Excellent location
Very good hotel!
reviews.text: My only criticisms:

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. Breakfast was delicious, but the service was absolutely terrible.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay downtown

reviews.text: 2. Check in was very slow and I noticed regular lines of people waiting to check in.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: Despite the breakfast service, I'll definitely will stay here again.
reviews.title: Don't Pay for Bay View

reviews.text: We paid $460 for one night for a room of 4x5 meters. Very overpriced for the fact that (1) the minibar was not full, (2) the interior looks and feels old and ugly, (3) the balcony is ridicoulousy small, (4) no plasma/lcd as tv, (5) overpriced room service, (6) poor food, and (7) no gadgets at all (usually, for such a price you get some nice ideas like superb shower cell, or just small things like champagne glasses, whatever...). The only good thing is its location and the nice view from the balcony.
reviews.title: Overpriced

likes.disliked: — The whole package was not right

reviews.title: Great Family Stay at the Marriott Marina San Diego
reviews.text: When we checked out, we realized that they charged my credit card ALREADY. We intended to split the bill, so they had to reverse the transaction, which resulted in the situation that my card card was empty till the reverse transaction is performed (which takes about 4-5 days). We had to wait more than 1 hour on the reception desk, till everything was 'okay'. Unbelievable bad checkout experience.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would never return there. I know that big hotel chains like Marriot etc have quality problems and that only the building shell and looby looks good, but this was defentitely below everything I've seen.
reviews.title: Good experience at Marriott Marina

likes.disliked: — The noise from the room next door

reviews.title: go to the Omni or the Hilton instead.....tired and "so so"
reviews.text: Wonderful vacation stay at the Marriott Marina with my family of 5. We had 2 connecting rooms with great views and a small refrigerator in each room.

reviews.title: ONot a typical Marriott
reviews.text: Great place to use as a base to explore all of San Diego tourist atractions (Zoo, Seaworld, LaJolla, Coronado, USS Midway,etc)

We stayed at this hotel for a work conference. We had a marina view from about the 20th floor, in the southern tower, and it was fantastic. This is near the Marina village area with restaurants and tourist shops, as well as the nearby downtown area with more nightlife and restaurants. We ate at Taka Sushi, where the food was good, but the service was slightly obnoxious; white rice was an additional charge, and it was a few dollars; come on, a bowl of rice should come with the each meal, or be $1 maximum.
reviews.title: Nice hotel for a convention, great marina location

likes.liked: — location, marina and water views, clean, good service
likes.disliked: — pricey dining options in the hotel

reviews.text: The hotel's pool was large, but a bit cool. The food in the hotel is a bit pricey. Definitely try to get a room looking out over the Marina side. You can see US Navy ships going by, as well as military jets. Very clean hotel with good service. The food in the convention hall was a B+. When we stayed there, internet was an additional charge.
reviews.title: Very Nice Vacation

reviews.text: We went to the San Diego Zoo, and the SD Zoo's Wild Animal Park about 45 minutes north, the Wild Animal Park was amazing, better than the Zoo downtown. We also bought some local strawberries and avocados from a farm stand up in the countryside, and the produce was incredibly fresh.
reviews.title: Mixed - Some Good / Some Not

likes.disliked: — Over-booking and getting bumped, bedding, and room temperature control.

reviews.text: My wife and I along with our 2 boys (21 months & 3 1/2 yrs) stayed 5 nights at this hotel from 8/20-8/25. We live in Orange County, California and wanted a nice get away vacation that did not entail having to fly or drive to far. San Diego seemed like the perfect idea as there is so much for families to do. Upon arrival, I immediately ran into problems checking in. I had reserved a city view king room using my rewards points and the room type was guaranteed . The front desk person said that only doubles were available as the hotel was completely sold out. I told her a king room would only work as we had 2 little ones and they would be sleeping in cribs. After spending about 5 minutes working on the computer and making some calls she informed me they did have a nice king room available in the south tower overlooking the pool and bay. She also gave me 2 gift bags for the boys that contained little toys and trinkets. A very nice gesture on her part. In the end we ended up with a nicer room then what I had booked with awesome views. My oldest son was so excited when we saw the room for the first time he kept jumping up and down. He especially enjoyed seeing the boats and trains go by. The room was clean and well maintained. No issues with tired looking furniture or worn and stained carpet as previous guests had noted in their reviews. All in all a very nice room.
reviews.title: Just OK

reviews.text: We enjoyed using the pool and the close proximity to Seaport Village, USS Midway and other attractions. Many guests had noted that they could here people in the rooms next to them and this was not an issued for us until the last night of our visit. We had a hard time falling asleep that last night as kids in the room directly above us were laughing and running around until midnight. Things got quiet once their parents came back to the room. We were then awakened 5 hours later by the people next door getting ready to leave for the airport. Then the guy on the other side of our room woke up at 6:15am and started talking to his girlfriend and burping. So if there is anything negative to say about this hotel it can be noisy if you have loud inconsiderate neighbors. One other downer, do not trust the valet parking attendants. We had $5.00 of quarters stolen out of our cars center console. Overall, our experience was a good one and we will have no reservations staying at this hotel again.
reviews.title: Should Have Listened to the Other Reviewers

reviews.text: Located next door to the Convention center on one side, Seaport Village on the other side, and walking distance to the Gaslamp Quarter, this Marriott is ideally located for business travelers coming to San Diego for a convention and a little fun in the sun.
reviews.title: Great Convention Hotel

reviews.text: Great outdoor pool area with numerous seating areas surrounding fire pits. The gym at this hotel is great. Everything you could want from a gym away from home. Parking was reasonable at $28 a night for self park with in & out privileges. Room was comfortable although we were unable to have a king room due to convention occupancy, but in exchange the front desk upgraded us to two doubles with a harbor view.
reviews.title: A Place for Everyone

reviews.text: I had the pleasure of going to a convention at the San Diego Convention Center. I stayed at the Marriot Marquis & Marina which is adjacent to the Center. From the moment I drove up I was treated by a staff who made it known that my comfort and enjoyment was their goal.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.text: Check in was simple and the young woman who checked me in actually came around the desk to hand me my key and show me how to go from the hotel to the convention center without traveling outside (which came I handy when it rained for two days).
reviews.title: Great location for Convention Center
Great Location for Conference
reviews.text: The room was spacious, well appointed with comfortable beds, a refrigerator large enough to hold the staples I bought from a local super market and the view of the water was grand. The coffee maker, iron and other amenities made life easy.

This was my second time to stay at this hotel while attending a conference. It is a short walk to the convention center, right on the water and close walking distance to nearby restaurants. The staff were exceptional from the check-in staff to the restaurant staff. It was very nice to have a coffee shop and deli right in the lobby for a quick breakfast. Do check out the water taxi that the Marriott operates to their property on Coronado Island. I was very pleased with everything at the hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent location for attending a conference

reviews.text: Really nice hotel. The hotel was clean and everyone was friendly. Things were a little costly but I kind of expected that since this was California. We really enjoyed the location, next door to the convention center and near good restaurants. We really enjoyed our stay but I have enjoyed equally nice hotels with less expense. Kudos to the housecleaning crew, they are worthy of praise.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in a nice location

reviews.text: I just had a great 2-night stay this past weekend. We travelled with a baby and 2 snorers, so after a rough 1st night, we opted for a 2nd room. Front desk was very helpful and was able to accommodate our request at a phenomenal rate and put us next door to our original room. Pool area is fantastic and felt more like a Mexican/Caribbean/Hawaiin resort. Excellent marina/sunset view from our standard/South Tower room and very close walk to Seaport Village. Marina Kitchen's chilaquiles (off the a la carte menu) for breakfast were super delish & I've since been craving them! We also ordered a later dinner from Marina Kitchen to-go one evening, which we were able to pick up ourselves in order to avoid the room service up-charge. This will definitely be my standard San Diego booking from now on. I have already booked another weekend here in August for a bachelorette party!
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.text: The most beautiful sight I have ever seen. The Marriotts view of the Marina and the Coronado Bridge. Words can not describe how exciting. The rooms and the employees are wonderful. I was recently at the San Diego Marriott with my husband and friends. It was my birthday and we were going out on the town. We wanted to go to a Jazz Bar or Club so when we were headed out we asked the lady in the parking booth at the Marriott if she knew of any good Jazz Clubs. She (I think her Name was Carlene) gave us 3 names that were on 5th Ave, House Of Blues, Patricks Pub and Croce's Resturant. We went to Croce's. WOW WONDERFUL along with the hotel. She was right. Thank you so much my birthday was perfect.
reviews.title: Jazzy Time!!!!
Great hotel and location
reviews.text: My husband and I recently stayed at the San Diego Marriott Marquis and Marina during our 5-day visit to San Diego from Toronto, Ontario. The staff was friendly, helpful and accommodating. The hotel was lovely and had all of the amenities. We were able to get an bay view which we would recommend. Being right on the shoreline of the bay, we had easy access to the boardwalk. This meant that many of the San Diego's attractions (e.g. the U.S.S. Midway, the Maritime Museum and the Sante Fe train station) were within an easy and scenic walking distance of the hotel. The hotel was also a short distance away from the Gaslamp District. We only wish the we could have extended our stay in order to have had more time to enjoy the pool area and its firepits.

Stayed here for a conference, with the convention center within a quick walking distance, which was very convenient. The check in was a bit slow as it was very busy, but we were able to check in early and the front desk staff was very polite and accomodating. Ate a couple of meals at the poolside bar, a bit pricey for me, but the food was good and the service was great! The staff was very friendly and attentive. WIFI in the room was spotty at best. Rooms are large, clean and the beds were very comfortable. Lots of shops and activities within walking distance, as well as Petco Stadium. Overall, a great stay!
reviews.title: Conference Stay

reviews.text: I go to a lot of convention hotels and this one is by far top on my list of favorites. The hotel is located right on the boardwalk, so it's easy to get to the Gaslamp District or to see the waterfront. Pool is very nice and the bar is friendly and fun. Roy's had great service and setting. Drinks and food were excellent. Breakfast in the hotel restaurant is the nicest buffet I've ever had. Yum. Great property, nice people and beautiful views!
reviews.title: Enjoyed every minute!

reviews.text: I stayed there in February and what to say about the service? So great !!! I will come back to this hotel for sure. Only negative comment.. The Conciergerie service should review the San Diego details more in details. We asked 2-3 questions and none of them was correct.
reviews.title: Really great hotel

reviews.text: Very nice place when one is attending a convention. Room to move around when there are crowds. Because of the scale of the building, particularly the lobby and common areas, no real feeling of being hemmed in. The pool side bar/cafe was a great touch. Unfortunately the weather was not San Diego advertised, so full effect couldn't be felt. Room was clean, efficient, quiet, and very well appointed. Towels were the soft, fluffy kind that hadn't started their career as the back side of sandpaper. Never figured out exactly why expensive hotels (this is one, at least at my pay grade) charge lots for wifi, while budget types have free wifi. Must be the expense account mentality. Didn't bother with room service. Did walk extensively around the area and the hotel is located wonderfully for a walker. Easy access to Gas Light District, Petco Park, and the Convention Center. I spent too much time at the Convention Center, not enough in the other places mentioned. I think this is a great convention and business stay. That special vacation might work here, but the cost seems a bit much for the spontaneous, let's get out of town, impulse trip.
reviews.title: Convention Central

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a fabulous hotel. Centrally located and with a breathtaking view. The staff was very helpful and the whole experience was fun. The hotel is a tad pricey but again everything is within easy walking distance. Petco Park is about 5 blocks away and the Gaslight district is literally across the street
reviews.title: WOW!!

reviews.text: Stayed here for 2 nights for a business trip this early august. The bed sheet had a very strong disinfectant smell the first night and I couldn't sleep very well. Other than that, everything else was as expected from a four star hotel and price. Good service, facilities are clean, great pool, and nice view. It's convenient and close to the convention centre. Overall it was a good experience.
reviews.title: Decent Hotel

reviews.text: This is a decent hotel - it's clean, the beds are soft, the bedding is new and the pool area very pleasant although small. The hotel is also right on the beach and within walking distance of downtown and GasLamp district. The trolley line goes right by the hotel, so it's easy to jump on and travel around the city.
reviews.title: Average hotel

likes.liked: — On the beach and within walking distance of attractions

reviews.title: Can I take the pool home with me?
reviews.text: A shuttle runs to the airport every half hour for the price of $5 one way.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here at a convention for the rate of $215 plus tax per night which, in my opinion, is highly overpriced for the quality of the property. Although everything is clean, the property itself is older and needs a bit of refurbishing. I would not stay here as a tourist as there are hotels of comparable quality available for much less money.
reviews.title: very nice with a conference room rate. great location and views.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Usually I laugh when I read the “great pool scene” rating on when I’m putting together a review. Swimming is my preferred exercise and the pool is generally an over-chlorinated, overheated pit in the basement. Not here. The Marriot has a huge pool, and the poolside is so popular there’s a sign prohibiting reserving beach chairs. The patrons were mostly 20-somethings, hanging out with each other and enjoying the great poolside bar. THIS is a great pool scene!
reviews.title: Better than expected!

likes.liked: — Clean and comfortable with friendly service.

reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 days and 2 nights as part of our honeymoon in Sept. First off, upon checking in we were warmly greeted and instantly upgraded to this room for our honeymoon, what a treat!!! We got a bayview room w/ a balcony in the North tower on the 23rd floor overlooking the bay. What a great view. A few minutes after we checked in, the manager sent up a complimentary bottle of champagne for us. Now that was classy!!! We happened to be in town during the Red Bull Airshow and it was just amazing to see the show below us from our balcony. Great view of Coronado as well. This hotel room had a small sitting area and a fridge in it. It was very convenient to Seaport Village and to downtown and the Gaslamp District. All within easy walking distance. Plenty of stores, restaurants and bars close by. We even walked up to Little Itally one day and had an excellent meal at a nice little trattoria there. We did spend some time at the pool, which was nice as well. All in all, a nice hotel which was clean and convenient to many of the downtown attractions.
reviews.title: Very Convenient, Best View of Bay

likes.liked: — Convenient to Downtown San Diego Attractions

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent stay at the Marriott!
reviews.title: Loved the Marriott Marina

reviews.text: My husband and I arrived from the East Coast at 10 PM on a Thursday evening for a 4 night stay. We were greeted by the valet and he quickly helped us with our bags. There was absolutely no line at check-in. I had requested a feather free room due to allergies. They originally did not have this request in their computer but they quickly and efficiently changed our room. We had booked a king bay view room on the hotel website. Make sure you check it out. They were running a special stay 3 nights get the 4th free. What an incredible savings this was.
reviews.title: 3 Star Hotel/4 Star Location

likes.disliked: — Giving us a double when we reserved a KING

reviews.text: Our room was in the south tower with a gorgeous view of Coronado Island, the pool, and Seaport Village. The room was clean-no hair, soap scum, etc. as other guest has mentioned. The bed was extremely comfortable. The room was a good size and had a chair with ottoman, a desk, and an armoire with TV. The bathroom was spacious and the bath products were very nice. You do hear the train occasionally but it really did not bother us much.
reviews.title: Average hotel

reviews.text: The location of this hotel is one of the best in the area. Only a 5 minute walk to Seaport Village and the Gaslamp Quarter. If you stay directly in the Gaslamp you will have considerable noise due to the large amount of bars and restaurants. The USS Midway was a 10 minute walk and well worth the trip.
reviews.title: Fantastic Place

likes.liked: — The bed, pillows and staff service

aka: San Diego Marriott Marquis & Marina Hotel San Diego
description: The centerpiece of the inspiring San Diego Bay, the San Diego Marriott Marquis & Marina is a premier San Diego, CA hotel. With 1,360 guest rooms, 75,000 sq ft of meeting space, a 446-slip marina & an environment that easily transitions from dynamic meetings to resort-style relaxation, the San Diego hotel is a welcome escape. Adjacent to the San Diego Convention Center and steps from the Gaslamp Quarter, our downtown San Diego, CA hotel’s location provides convenient access to championship golf and popular attractions like the San Diego Zoo, Sea World San Diego and LEGOLAND California. Experience a grand sense of arrival in the new lobby our San Diego hotel & personalized service from our dedicated staff. Unwind in a renovated guest room with sweeping bay views. From a state-of-the-art fitness center, to an enticing new pool area, to top-notch cuisine at our waterfront restaurants, it all comes together for an authentic downtown San Diego experience, only at the San Diego Marquis & Marina.
